template.name: Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP
template.description: Template para monitoramento de host que hospedam os componentes do ICM. UCCE vers√£o 11.5 com o uso de proxy.

item.name: Name
item.description: The name is the fully-qualified domain name of the enterprise contact center application server.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentElmtStatus[{#SNMPVALUE},{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>{Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentElmtStatus[{#SNMPVALUE},{#SNMPINDEX}].last(#2)}
trigger_prototype.name: Mudan√ßa de status do {#SNMPVALUE} CTI Server no {HOST.NAME1}
trigger_prototype.description: Mudan√ßa de status do elemento {#SNMPVALUE} no CTI Server {HOST.NAME1}.

item_prototype.name: Status of $1
item_prototype.description: The component status is the last known status of the enterprise contact center application functional component.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=3 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=5 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=6 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=7 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=8 or {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaComponentStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=9
trigger_prototype.name: Mudan√ßa de status do componente {#SNMPVALUE} no {HOST.NAME1}
trigger_prototype.description:
Mudan√ßa de status do componente {#SNMPVALUE} no {HOST.NAME1} com o IP:{HOST.IP1}.
Componentes iniciados ou desabilitados, n√£o geram alarmes.

item_prototype.name: HDS Replication
item_prototype.description: The logger type object indicates which type of enterprise contact center application logger is installed on this server. The logger type varies based on the configuration of the contact center solution. 'standard':The default logger type configured for an enterprise contact center solution. 'nam':The network application manager (NAM) logger type is installed at a telephony service provider and supports the routing of inbound voice calls to a customer intelligent contact management application solution. 'cicm':The customer intelligent contact manager (CICM) logger type is installed as part of a customer instance of an enterprise contact center application solution. The CICM component manages contacts routed by the NAM component, distributing contacts to customer premise peripheral devices or contact center agents.

item_prototype.name: Logger Side
item_prototype.description: The logger side indicates which of the duplex pair this entry represents of an enterprise contact center application fault tolerant logger functional component. The logger side value is either 'A' or 'B'. For simplex configurations, the logger side value defaults to 'A'.

item_prototype.name: Type
item_prototype.description: The logger type object indicates which type of enterprise contact center application logger is installed on this server. The logger type varies based on the configuration of the contact center solution. 'standard':The default logger type configured for an enterprise contact center solution. 'nam':The network application manager (NAM) logger type is installed at a telephony service provider and supports the routing of inbound voice calls to a customer intelligent contact management application solution. 'cicm':The customer intelligent contact manager (CICM) logger type is installed as part of a customer instance of an enterprise contact center application solution. The CICM component manages contacts routed by the NAM component, distributing contacts to customer premise peripheral devices or contact center agents.

item_prototype.name: PG Agents Logged $1
item_prototype.description: The agents logged On object shows the number of agents associated with this peripheral gateway that are currently logged on and are being managed/monitored by this peripheral gateway.

item_prototype.name: PG Agents Ready $1
item_prototype.description: The agents ready object shows the number of agents associated with this peripheral gateway that are currently logged on and in a 'Ready' state, i.e., ready to receive calls.

item_prototype.name: PG Agents Talking $1
item_prototype.description: The agents talking object shows the number of agents associated with this peripheral gateway that are currently logged on and taking a call (in a 'Talking' state.

item_prototype.name: PG Calls in Progress $1
item_prototype.description: The calls in progress object shows the number of calls that are currently active and being managed/monitored by this peripheral gateway.

item_prototype.name: PG Number $1
item_prototype.description: The PG number is a user-defined numeric identifier for this enterprise contact center application peripheral gateway. The value is limited by the contact center application to a value between 1 and 80;80 is the maximum number of peripheral gateways supported by the application. This object has been deprecated since its range is now inappropriate;the number of peripheral gateways supported in a deployment increased to 150 in ICM/CC version 7.5 and again up to 250 in ICM/CC version 8.0.

item_prototype.name: $1 Side
item_prototype.description: The PG side indicates which of the duplex pair this entry represents of an enterprise contact center application fault tolerant peripheral gateway functional component. The PG side value is either 'A' or 'B'. For simplex configurations, the PG side value defaults to 'A'.

discovery_rule.name: PimTable
discovery_rule.description: The PIM table lists the enterprise contact center application peripheral interface managers (PIM) configured and enabled on this peripheral gateway functional component. The PIM table is dependent upon both the instance table and the PG table;the instance index acts as the primary index and the PG index a secondary index. This indexing method ensures that PIM entries are properly related to its parent peripheral gateway and to the appropriate instance. The PIM table has an expansion dependent relationship with the peripheral gateway table. There may be one or more PIM entries associated with a single peripheral gateway entry. The instance index acts as the primary index and the component index a secondary index. This indexing method ensures that PIM entries are properly related to its parent peripheral gateway and to the appropriate instance. The SNMP agent assigns the PIM number, based upon the configuration, when each PIM table entry is created. The SNMP agent constructs the PIM table at startup. Since PIMs can only be configured while the enterprise contact center application is stopped, PIM table entries cannot be added to or deleted from the table either by the agent or the management station when the application is running. The agent will update PIM entry objects as their values change when the application is running. All objects in this table are read-only to the management station.

item_prototype.name: PIM Peripheral Name $1
item_prototype.description: The PIM peripheral name is the user-defined textual name of the enterprise contact center application PIM. This name uniquely identifies the PIM.

item_prototype.name: $1 Peripheral Type
item_prototype.description: The PIM peripheral type object specifies the type of the enterprise contact center application PIM, e.g. the brand name and/or model of the automatic call distributor (ACD), private branch exchange (PBX) or voice response unit (VRU).

item_prototype.name: $1 Status
item_prototype.description: The PIM status object holds the last known status of the enterprise contact center application peripheral interface manager functional component.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaPimStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>5 and {Template Cisco UCCE V11.5 SNMP:cccaPimStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>6
trigger_prototype.name: Mudan√ßa de status do {#SNMPVALUE} no {HOST.NAME1}
trigger_prototype.description: Mudan√ßa de status do {#SNMPVALUE} no {HOST.NAME1} com IP:{HOST.IP1}

trigger_prototype.name: Sem dados da aplica√ß√£o PIM nos √∫ltimos 10 minutos

item_prototype.name: Router Agents Logged
item_prototype.description: The router agents logged on object represents the number of contact center agents currently managed by the enterprise contact center application. This does not necessarily represent the number of contact center agents that can receive routed calls, but rather the number of agents for which the application is recording statistical information.

item_prototype.name: Router Calls in Progress
item_prototype.description: The router calls in progress object indicates the current number of active (voice) calls being managed by the enterprise contact center application. The calls will be in various states of treatment.

item_prototype.name: Router Calls in Queue
item_prototype.description: The router calls in queue object indicates the total number of calls queued in all network Voice Response Units (VRUs), from the router's perspective, including those calls that are in the process of transferring to the VRU for queuing.

item_prototype.name: Router Side
item_prototype.description: The router side indicates which of the duplex pair this entry represents of an enterprise contact center application fault tolerant router functional component. The router side value is either 'A' or 'B'. For simplex configurations, the router side value defaults to 'A'.
